Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl2008
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at this hotel before and were a little skeptical, since we normally stay at a larger hotel. We will definitely be back. Our check-in was handled by a very nice young man, who gave us 10% off certificates for the Bistro, explained exactly where to park nearest our room, and was so enthusiastic and helpful that we knew we were starting off right. The hotel has a Go-Board, which is the latest in technology. You can find weather, news, restaurants, and other information on this board. The afternoon check-in woman helped us find a restaurant, printed out the directions, and called to make us a reservation. We wanted a drink at the Bistro at about 4:45. The Bistro doesn't open until 5:00, but the individual behind the bar was gracious enough to serve us. We even said we would wait until he opened, but he said he would be happy to serve us before opening. When we needed ice, my husband went to look for it, ran into the manager of the property, and she got the ice for him! Unheard of in a larger hotel. All in all, this was a very pleasant stay - very nice pool and spa, good exercise room, fast free WiFi, lovely people. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very close to Qualcomm, great location for business”
Reviews.Author: SickofRain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of Qualcomm campus, so if you are visiting Qualcomm, it is a great location. It is about 25 mins drive to San Diego downtown, close to I5 and to 805. Many restaurants nearby. Hotel has a decent restaurant for breakfast. Outdoor pool and indoor hot tub are very nice too. Free WIFI, newspaper and coffee. Overall, a very decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: shakmanMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weekend nights and everything was great. Typical Courtyard with redone lobby. Everything was clean. Very handy location off I805 and close to I5. Good place to stay if touring San Diego as Parking Is Free here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel outside of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: gsuzuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in February and had no major complaints. Here are my comments: Checking In: After flying overnight from Honolulu, I arrived at the hotel at about 11:00 am. The gentleman that assisted me was very helpful and the best part was he was able to check me in early. Something I really appreciated considering I cannot sleep on the plane. The person told suggested I drive around the building becasue the elevator was closer to the back door. Room: I was in the standard room on the third floor. If my memory serves me correctly, there was only three floors and I had the room facing the back of the hotel so there was no noise at night. The room had a refrigerator and the internet worked well. Location: As others have mentioned, this hotel is located in a business area, with several companies in the surrounding area. The only restaurant I saw that was within a walking distance was a Karl Strauss Brewery. I did not go but it looked busy. Down the road (you could walk it, but there is a busy intersection and it's kind of hilly), there is a small shopping area that has a McDonalds, a food court, a bank, and some other businesses including a gas station. The food court closes at 4:30 with several other eateries closing later. I did not see a supermarket near by, however I did not ask the front desk for any. Downtown San Diego is about 15 miles away. If you don't have a car, it could take a while to get there. I drove to Pacific Beach and it took about 15 minutes. Pacific Beach is a beach community with several restaurants and grocery stores. I heard La Jolla is nearby, I did not check it out myself. I can say that Torrey Pines took me about 20 minutes to drive to and from during a week day afternoon. Negatives: The only minor negative was the entrance to the hotel. When you are driving, you might have to turn left into the drive. Most of the drivers was nice enough for me to drive in, but if you are there when the workers from the nearby building are going home, it can be kind of scary turning into the driveway. There is a second entrance as you go up the hill, but it was closed when I was there. As you can see, my only complaint was very minor. This Courtyard achieved it's purpose. If you stay here, I would recommend having a car especially if you wish to go to downtown San Diego. I did not try the public transportation, and maybe it might work for some of you. But to get around, it would be better with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Best Courtyard I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon_Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this Courtyard - I can't say enough good things about it! I'll be honest, I didn't make the reservations and have no idea how much we paid, so I am not evaluating this for 'value for the money' but it's a Courtyard - I can't imagine it was much more than any other one. The little Starbucks bistro served a great breakfast, and even the evening drinks were fantastic. I loved the layout of the lounge and the lobby. It was quick, efficient, friendly, and inviting. It was certainly hipper than any Courtyard I've ever seen. The rooms were spacious and well laid-out, and the bathroom was perfect. The only issues I had during my stay was that the gym was full between 6 and 7:30, so I had to wait for equipment (longest wait was only 10 mins) and there was quite a bit of sand in the tap water - so much that when I arrived there was sand in the bathtub, and the next day, after I brushed my teeth, there was a ring of sand in the sink. So don't drink the tap water. (Sand in the water is new to me, yucky tap water at a hotel is pretty normal.) All-in-all, I say this is a fantastic hotel! I was really impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Service was awesome, lobby was beautiful, but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard Marriott is wedged in a business park, surrounded by high-tech firms and near a couple of small businesses that cater to lunch time seekers during business, just as you would expect it to be. (Don't' expect the nearby restaurants--Subway, Rubios, etc. to remain open during evenings, especially weekends.) The staff was fantastic--very friendly and always helpful. One even helped my husband and I with the big multi-media map and printed off directions to Torrey Pines for us. On our morning departure another staff member found the restaurant we were looking for in Del Mar (for a lovely brunch) on the registration computer and printed out directions for us. The lobby is updated like all the other Courtyard Marriotts--looked pretty identical to the one in New Orleans where we were just a few weeks ago. The rooms are clean, but it's time for an update. The wallpaper seemed a little outdated and there could be some nice touches to updating and decorating (taking lessons from what they did to the rooms at the New Orleans property--those were nicely decorated rooms). The shower/tub didn't drain (we were up to our ankles in water) but hey, they probably didn't know about that so I let the management know when I left so they could get it fixed. They person who I told was so apologetic he offered me a free coffee or juice and I said that wouldn't be necessary. I'm sure the property has probably got its rooms on the list to get updated. But overall, the mattress is still very comfortable (and I'm VERY picky about my mattresses), everything worked in the room, and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: tag1984
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 10+ times and have been pleased with each stay. The staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is great. Most of my trips have been for business in the area, but I have returned for a couple of personal vacations because of the quality of this place. The location isn't sexy, but is close enough to downtown San Diego, La Jolla attractions and not too bad of a drive to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ryanpeg
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here, with 3 rooms. Tommy, at the front desk, was great checking us all in with at least 2 calls holding! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Location is great - we were 30 min from zoo and across the street from a Karl Strauss pub! I did find that the bathroom needs a bit of an update with a rocky toilet and slow moving drain in tub. I also asked that someone clean the back middle entrance - both days there was something spilled in front of door and bird poop around - while it was not cleaned while we were there - Tommy assures me it would be cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little oddly laid out but there are several entrances to the property. The staff was very friendly referring to me by my last name as though I had been a guest there many times before (first time) The cafe that is inside the hotel has decent prices, and there was free coffee (mornings only) and water available. I found the location to be convenient as there are several restaurant choices not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “The gym is a steam room with 3 sets of dumbbells”
Reviews.Author: jenntish
Reviews.Content: The gym looks nothing like the picture--there was literally moisture in the air it was so humid. 3 sets of weights. Terrible. Fluorescent lights in all the rooms. Energy efficient, yes. Relaxing, not so much. The lobby area was totally re-done and looks fresh and modern... But I don't spend all my time there! I will stay elsewhere next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a quick business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Anibas44
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Check in was quick, cafe was good in the evening for a sandwich and a glass of wine. Morning coffee available. I was just in and out for one night, so didn't really use any of the other services at the hotel but would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long day at Sea World. The hotel was about 15 minutes from Sea World. We checked in and the agent sent us to the wrong door to park near. We ended up having to go in and back out of a different door to find our room. Aside from that the room was really nice. We enjoyed the pool area and hot tub. I think our 2 year old like the hotel more than Sea World :) Nice hotel to bring your family to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hospitality In the Middle of a Gray Business Park”
Reviews.Author: Oldink
Reviews.Content: Ten minutes from La Jolla, Torrey Pines, San Diego. But this hotel sits among the gray cement buildings of a business park. Mirco-this and tech-that and I was there without a car (long story) and dependent on the good folk of this Courtyard Inn for survival and some color. All right, I was there to visit my son who was on weekend duty at Pendleton, which is why I didn't have a car. If that explains why I didn't have a car. Or not. The folk at the front desk helped me arrange a surprise for my son, who didn't know I would be there. Lesley or Leslie, sorry I don't know the spelling of her name, a manager. Exceptionally helpful and pleasant. She was the first "associate" I met, but all the staff were just great. Let's say that I've stayed at supposedly tonier joints. A place in Hollywood with a letter for a name. I don't want to mention it. Okay, four letters from the end of the alphabet. Several bucks a night, exclusive roof, all that. Could not touch this Courtyard Inn. I'll shut up. It's just the way it should always be when you're not at home in your own bed. My thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: GigemAggie
Reviews.Content: Generally I like Marriott Courtyard hotels and this is a nice hotel that is clean, in good condition, close driving distance to nearby restaurants, and friendly staff. However, as a business traveler, I need functioning high-speed Internet access and this hotel does not provide it. I've stayed here twice over the past three years, and both times, the Internet access in the room was horrible. I see why Internet access is free...how can they charge for something that barely works! On the last trip, I had to resort to using my 3G WWAN device as that was much quicker than what the hotel could provide. My other gripe is the lack of wireless access within the rooms. I'd like to use my iPad in the room, but wireless access was extremely weak. I do like the little restaurant area they have, which provides breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The food has always been good and the service quick. For me, I just wish they started serving breakfast earlier than 6:30am. While I like the location of this hotel, I will probably look for a different place the next time I find myself in the area as the lack of Internet access is a big negative for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but better options nearby”
Reviews.Author: Asten77
Reviews.Content: This property is nice, with rooms surrounding a courtyard (no pun intended). The lobby and rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Pros: Clean, pleasant, very close to interstate, Karl Strauss Brewpub across the street. Cons: Internet problems, pay breakfast, slowest elevators known to man, not many close restaurant options. The biggest gripe is that every time I go, the internet has been non-functional. Three trips, separated by about 2-3 months each, and each time I was told it was "being upgraded". For a business traveler needing to get work done, this is kind of a dealbreaker. Perhaps the internet is fixed by now - but even if it is, there's other options nearby which are very similar, but include breakfast. I'd go with one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit as this Hotel double charged me, dirty pool/jacuzzi and alcohol drinking”
Reviews.Author: ANDY1888
Reviews.Content: I paid $80 and booked this hotel ahead of time. We checked in and stayed there for one night. We called and checked out of this hotel at 10:10am the following day. A few weeks later, a suspicious charge of $51.84 appeared on my credit card. I contacted Marriott.com and they referred this to Charlie Smith (General Manager of the Hotel). Charlie Smith acknowledged the fact that I had been ripped off by the hotel and offer me 1000 Marriott Points statng that it was worth $100 for the inconvenience. This is a slap in the face as when I checked the Marriott website, it states that 35000 Marriot points is equivalent to $100. Check your credit card statement at they will try to double charge you. The swimming pool was filthy and you cannot see the bottom of the pool. The jacuzzi was so nasty that after I got out, my body had a weird odor. There were no clean pool towels but only a stack of dirty towels. Also there were a lot of people drinking alcohol where the swimming pool was located. This hotel should not be rated as a 3 star hotel. It is more like 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “High price for disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: bob_pate
Reviews.Content: I was to stay at this hotel for four nites. The hotel is nearby Qualcomm facility so if anyone is visiting Qualcomm, it is ideal location. This is an older model of Courtyard hotel -- where all rooms are accessible from outside. The hotel has small courtyard in the middle of the facility and all rooms have sliding doors to go to the courtyard.. The sliding doors are masked by curtain. After entering the room and checking the overall security, noticed that the sliding doors were fully open -- one would not know that there is security issue. (Why would the sliding doors be left open once a room is cleaned for next guest?) Then I tried to lock the sliding doors -- however, the lock mechanism is not easy to engage and one can't be sure whether it worked properly. I raised the concern with the front desk and they did nothing of it (meaning - no response from them of my concern). No wireless internet in the room. Had to park my laptop on the desk all times. Tried to iron few clothes -- fill the iron (halfway with the water). After the iron got hot and as I was pressing my clothes, it started to leak and spilled water on my clothes. Left permanent marks on my clothes. The room is need of major renovation. Got old console TV. The business center facility -- tried to print few docs (few pages). The printer(s) were out of the ink and blank paper. After first night stay, I checked out and stayed in a different hotel nearby. Best decision I made during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise alternative hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: This is obviously a business hotel located across the street from Qualcom headquarters. We were looking for a reasonable hotel Labor Day weekend near La Jolla and always knew we could count on Marriott for a decent stay. We were not disappointed and actually rather impressed given the price. All other hotels in the area were signficantly higher. We had a choice of breakfast included in the price and chose not to as our breakfast plans were to be outside the hotel. Our plans changed and we ended up eating quickly before we left town and had a decent breakfast for a reasonable amount. We arrived early and we were given a room immediately by Toms, a student in hotel management from Riga, Latvia. He was so charming and welcoming. We requested a quiet room and were so provided. The lobby was newly renovated and had everything one would need: coffee, internet, tv area, wifi, and a small open restaurant. The fitness center was small but had the newest machines. We spent the early afternoon poolside relaxing until evening event. It was virtually empty instead of the pools packed with kids. The rooms were minimally decorated and were certainly acceptable...remember this is a Courtyard...not the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: DennisSyrkowski
Reviews.Content: We stayed 27 August, for a gymnastics event nearby. The hotel staff are great - very friendly and made check in smooth. The pool and hot tub here are in great shape and very clean. Great to have this to kill time on a sunny day. The hotel has been updated with the new Courtyard design and cafe. This worked great for breakfast. This location is also quiet and is not near major roads. One complaint, and this applies to most Courtyards - the in wall air conditioners are very loud and will wake you up as they cycle on and off. I don't understand why Marriott uses these cheap noisy AC units. I may have to consider staying at another chain in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great value”
Reviews.Author: damnitshot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business. The lobby has recently been renovated and is very well done. It is well designed, plenty of places to sit and is set up extremely well for the business traveler with lots of plugs and free wi-fi. They also have tv's with remote controls in each dining booth and a nice outside lounge area and pool. The service all around is exceptional, including at check in and the "restaurant." Everyone that works here is very nice and accommodating. They even let me check in at 10am when I arrived. The food at the dining area is very good and reasonably priced. The hotel is also a terrific value. There is free parking and, as previously mentioned, free internet access in the lobby and rooms. They also have a business center with several computers and free printing! I got a great rate using my AAA card. The location is very good - unless you want to be near downtown. I had business in Sorrento so it was perfect with great access to Del Mar and La Jolla as well. There are good places to eat (casual) down the street. The one downside is that the rooms haven't been updated in a while. They are comfortable but the tv's are old and the beds aren't very soft. They told me they will be updating the rooms next year so, at that time, the hotel will be a 4 star hotel for the cost of a 2 star. I highly recommend staying here. Even if you need to be downtown a bit - it only took me 20 min (not traffic hour) but the cost was probably a third of what you would pay at an "upscale" hotel or a decent hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Wolftever
Reviews.Content: I was at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles Friday night for work; I had to be in San Diego early Saturday morning for another meeting. I drove down, and what a terrible experience it was! Traffic was simply horrible. I had booked the Courtyard in La Jolla in advance because of its proximity to my meeting at a local clinic. I was very tired and irritable and extremely hungry when I got there to check in. The guy at the front desk was very nice and made me feel at home immediately. I was about to ask him where the closest decent restaurant was when I realized there was a full-service bistro in the lobby! He informed me they were open for another hour. I got settled into my room and wandered back up to check the menu out. I ended up ordering a French Dip sandwich with the accompanying fries and cole slaw. i wasn't expecting much, but the sandwich was very good (it had Cheddar cheese), and the fries and slaw were much better than i had any right to expect! My room was nice, clean and comfortable. Was very happy with this stay. I woke up relaxed and refreshed, ready for another hard day at work. Couldn't have been happier with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Courtyard, great service”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is excellent. It is located near La Jolla (driving distance - it would be impossible to walk), and has a wonderfully renovated lobby. Stayed here with my Dad and brother after we checked out the Miramar Air Show. Booked a twin room, and there was no trouble to put a rollaway bed in the room for the third person. Competent helpful staff, the usual expected quality of a Marriott Courtyard made this stay comfortable and everything I expected.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs down for housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: jessicatravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding in August. The hotel was nice enough, but the maid service could really use improvment. Coffee maker filled with old coffee, lipstick on the mugs, and a good amount of hair on the floor. On the second day, the maid started cleaning my room while I was in the shower, despite the "do not disturb" sign on the door. And for some reason, she only made one of the two beds in the room for our second night. The handwriting on the "your room has been cleaned by" note in the room was that of a serial killer, so we didn't actually complain directly. The pool was nice, and they had a nice little selection of snack-food and supplies for sale in the lobby. It would really take the place up a notch if the restaurant/coffee bar at least sold coffee and easy pastries during the day. After breakfast, it closes at like 11, just in time for the late-risers to miss out. And like others have said, it is definitely in an office park.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed -- won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: NWTRNR
Reviews.Content: This location is well out of the way. Horrible traffic trying to get almost anywhere at many times of the day. The hotel just upgraded their front lobby and cafe area. Which, while nice, had some kinks... (e.g. one day we went down for breakfast, but almost all the tables had not been bussed) But one major dealbreaker for us was the horrible internet service. We barely could get 128k (basically dial-up speed) through wifi or ethernet. Finally had to ditch their internet in lieu of tethering to our mobile phone. This is ridiculous for any hotel anymore, especially one located in a business park. Also, the rooms were a bit small, the bathroom had no vent fan, and the inside of the rooms were a bit dated looking. Ditch the fake plastic trees already. Plus, the couch was uncomfortable. My kids also found a half-full bottle of red wine in one cabinet apparently left behind by the former room occupants (or maid?), and managed to quickly and easily open the double-paned security window in the bedroom, and could have easily fallen out had we not been right there (we were on the third floor). These sealed the deal. We won't be back. Also to note....fighter jets buzzed by overhead often (a military airport is very close by). On the few positive sides, with the windows and sliding door shut, it is quiet. The bed was comfortable. The pool and spa were fine. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “HAIR IN THE SHEETS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marriottsorrento
Reviews.Content: Location is reasonable. Close to Del Mar, La Jolla Beach and Sea World. The lobby is beautiful. The flat screen in the lobby is a touch screen info. directory. Able to use to find restaurants. Our room they checked us in was NASTY. Wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off behind the toilet and the shower curtain was moldy and something SMELLED. Called front desk and requested to change rooms right away. Front desk employee named Tommy changed us ASAP! That was wonderful. However, although the next room was much, much better and smelled cleaner, we lifted one of the bedsheets to put down our infant and saw pieces of hair ALL over the fitted sheet inside!!!! I picked off a bunch of them and just got toooooo frustrated as well as grossed out that I had to call the front desk again and told Tommy to send up fresh sheets!!!!!!!! I had to change everything down to the yellow stained mattress pad. I had to replace the sheets myself with the help of the housekeeping personnel. The bathroom in this new room was much better. At least the wallpaper was intact and the room smelled fresher. The workout room was substandard. The air conditioner was not working however I called engineering right away and he fixed it within a 1/2 an hour. Unfortanately, my workout was 3/4 over! The restaurant downstairs was only open for breakfast and dinner. NOT LUNCH! That sucked especially with having kids. Would've loved food readily available all day. The nearby Starbucks, Quiznos, JambaJuice and other restaurants down the street closes super EARLY. Starbucks at 5pm, Quiznos at 3p. That sucked too! The hotel staff at the front desk NEVER SMILED, seemed unhappy (except for Tommy). The hotel room door must be made of plywood. Can hear everything in the hallway from the inside. Can hear another door slamming down the hallway. Can hear the elevator lobby of people coming in and out. That sucked! They should replace all the doors to muffle the outside noise. Last but not least, on our last night we arrived late and parked in the back of the hotel where there was an entrance into the rooms. Unloaded 3 of our half asleep children along with heavy bags. Used the key card to open the doors to enter and THEY DID NOT WORK!!!! Had to pack the kids back into the car and my husband walked with the stroller with all three bags in tow all the way to the front of the hotel to tell the front desk what had happened. All he said was, "oh, must of been demagnitized from either a cell phone or computer." We told him that was impossible seeing that we had left both of them inside the glove compartment alllllll day. All he did was shrug his shoulders! What a bad way to end the day. The next morning we checked out and was soooooo happy to help ourselves with the compliementary coffee downstairs only to see that the cannisters were empty!!!!!! Great way to end our stay! Will not stay again and neither should you. The price for this hotel is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard, Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard in sorrento Valley on June 5 through the 8th. Beautiful accomodations, close to everything. Beds were nice, we had a room that looked out over the pool, close to the spa and to the lobby. check in was very good with the attendent bring a play pen to our room right away even though we had arrived quite late. Food was good in the lobby even though you had to pay for it. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A new standard has been set.”
Reviews.Author: agourasean
Reviews.Content: This is the cleanest most comfortable hotel the beds were super comfortable. I Really enjoyed the ammenities from the pool to the computers in lobby it was all just so perfectly set up. I would reccomend and will stay at this hotel whenever I go to the San Diego Area.

Reviews.Title: “I highly reccommend this hotel to people enjoy an environment of tranqulity & comfort coupled w/excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesSDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got into to San Diego around 11:30 and i was tired. I waled into the hotel lobby and was greeted by a pleasant front desk clerk. She could tell that I was tired so she quickly got my checked in and directed me to my room. The room was very quiet and peaceful. The bed was much more comfortable than my bed at home or the bed I slept in the weekend before at a different hotel. In the morning, I swam in the pool and my husband hung out and looked at all the local attractions on this super cool touch screen television they have in the lobby. They have a Starbuck's in the lobby and we eat breakfast there in one of the booth tables that has it's own television. Before we headed out for the day we took a walk through the courtyard. We loved it. We love San Diego anyway but that hotel is our favorite place to stay when we visit one of our favorite towns.

Reviews.Title: “very.........decent”
Reviews.Author: madddskillz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 4 and a half months flying in and out on weekends. what can I say about this place... overall it's not bad, but not great. The rooms were clean. Standard courtyard rooms. Free parking. No perks or anything at this location. One thing I can comment on is the gym is very very poor. Especially if you're interested in weights. It does have a fair amount of treadmills however.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but very pricey.”
Reviews.Author: ColonelPanic
Reviews.Content: I had my "guaranteed" room given away by the Holiday Inn Express Old Town. (SD seems to lack hotel rooms) so they comped me a night here. I paid for the next night at 279. Fairly outrageous for a room that hasnt been updated in a while. problems: noisy AC unit. AC Wall controller hard to figure out Iron was badly corroded. Bedding was very old and close to threadbare in places. no complimentary breakfast! Get with the flow Marriot, what are business travelers paying for?

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing change after switching from 2 other hotels”
Reviews.Author: nanny5025
Reviews.Content: Met up with our family to see the sights of San Diego, we checked in to two other hotels that were digusting and found this online. It was a wonderful oasis, to sleep in a clean room, with a working shower it was heaven. The grounds of the hotel were very lovely and made us appreciate the other Marriotts we have stayed in, both Residence Inn and Courtyard. The breakfast was wonderful but was a little put off by the fact for the high price of the room we had to pay for that too, although our grandchildrens meals were free. The laundry facilities were an added bonus. Staff was especially friendly, especially BeeJay. We would not hesitate to stay at this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: og832
Reviews.Content: Great place! Staff was fantastic, knowledgeable, and very welcoming. The rooms, lobby, and restaurant we impeccable maintained, and the courtyard was beautiful. They even have a smoking area set up in the courtyard, so I didn't feel like an outcast having to walk out to the street! They also just added free wireless internet in the rooms and lobby, and also have a free computer in the lobby so I could print my boarding pass without having to pay or hassle! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: NJDebster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great overall except a little pricey. But others were even more expensive. I looked at many others before picking this one. We came to San Diego to visit family and see the sites. This hotel is located in the Golden Triangle, an industrial office park area for high tech companies. The area was quiet as a result and not much close by. Getting to any of the sites of SD took about 30 minutes driving. The hotel room was great and had a refrigerator. There was a nice hot breakfast buffet every morning. Although we did not use it, the pool looked beautiful. There is free coffee in the lobby all day and there was free high speed internet in the rooms. My only issues with the hotel were the distance from tourist attractions (not the hotel's fault) and the expensive room price. I got a Residence Inn condo (2 BR, 2 BA) in LA for less than this room. Would I stay again - no reason not to but I would probably look for something closer to the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, I guess....”
Reviews.Author: fishgod1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. As others have stated here, there are quite a few businesses (e.g. every insurance company seems to have a branch nearby) and it gets full, quickly. The rooms were nice and there's a Quiznos nearby which is helpful since they do not serve any lunch or dinner (breakfast, yes). Would I stay here again? Probably not. While on business (which seems true for a majority of the guests) the lack of even a simple dinner menu is a deal-breaker. The hotel is in the middle of a huge industrial park so strolling to a nearby restaurant or cafe will require a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: NYFamilyonVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, 9/10-11. The room appeared renovated: new bed, fixtures and carpet. Our room was clean and service was fast. If anything could use improvement at this place, it would be the hall lighting, carpeting, and door paneling. They look like they're from the 70s. Updating these would make it visually more pleasing. The location is not bad either. It's right by I-805, and is a easy drive to most tourist attractions. For the money, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After going through a horrid experience at Motel 6 Downtown, we found this place which took us in. Wonderful customer service...beautiful king suites...and a delightful experience overall. Highly recommended and not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just remodeled friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bucks16
Reviews.Content: Just remodeled. Nice pool-heated--and hot tub. A one minute walk is Karl Strauss Brewery. Good food and beer. Got room on Priceline for $48 a night.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Sorrento Mesa/La Jolla
HotelInfo.Address: 9650 Scranton Road, San Diego, CA 92121
